text:
Louis Szekely (born September 12, 1967) or Louis C.K. is an American comedian, writer, director, editor and actor. He is known for the series "Louie". He won two Emmy Awards between in 1999 and 2012.
C.K. was born in Washington, D.C.. C.K. married Alix Bailey from 1995 to 2008. They have two children.
In November 2017, "The New York Times" reported that five women said that C.K. committed sexual misconduct allegations.
